title: datalad.tests.test_auto.test_proxying_open_testrepobased stalls while test building 0.14.0rc1 for debian

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
I thought it was still building (since yesterday) across releases but apparently it just stalled at

```
datalad.tests.test_auto.test_proxying_open_testrepobased ...
```

it isn't CPU busy etc... `ps` shows no child processes:

```
neurode+ 23455  0.0  0.0  19720 16988 pts/2    S+   Jan26   0:00                         /usr/bin/perl /usr/bin/dpkg-buildpackage -us -uc
neurode+ 23503  0.0  0.0   2696  2012 pts/2    S+   Jan26   0:00                           /usr/bin/make -f debian/rules build
neurode+ 23504  0.0  0.0  17632 15028 pts/2    S+   Jan26   0:00                             /usr/bin/perl /usr/bin/dh build --with python3 --buildsystem=pybuild
neurode+ 23538  0.0  0.0   2700  2020 pts/2    S+   Jan26   0:00                               /usr/bin/make -f debian/rules override_dh_auto_test
neurode+ 23539  0.0  0.0   2420   580 pts/2    S+   Jan26   0:00                                 /bin/sh -c PATH=/build/datalad-0.14.0~rc1/bin:$PATH \     dh_auto_test -- --test-nose
neurode+ 23540  0.0  0.0  20720 18168 pts/2    S+   Jan26   0:00                                   /usr/bin/perl /usr/bin/dh_auto_test -- --test-nose
neurode+ 23548  0.0  0.0  17056 13696 pts/2    S+   Jan26   0:00                                     /usr/bin/python3 /usr/bin/pybuild --test --test-nose -i python{version} -p 3.9 --test-nose
neurode+ 23557  0.0  0.0   2420   524 pts/2    S+   Jan26   0:00                                       /bin/sh -c cd '/build/datalad-0.14.0~rc1/.pybuild/cpython3_3.9_datalad/build'; python3.9 -m nose -v -s -v -e test_basics
neurode+ 23558  0.7  0.1 899136 137836 pts/2   Sl+  Jan26   8:08                                         python3.9 -m nose -v -s -v -e test_basics
```

edit 1: reran just in case "as is" -- the same, so not just a fluke

yet to troubleshoot... worse comes to worse -- might need a skip for debian package building so **even though I am adding 0.14.0 milestone, it should not hold the release**
